00065 /***************************************************************************/
00096 void LESENSE_Init(LESENSE_Init_TypeDef const *init, bool const reqReset)
00097 {
00098   /* Sanity check of initialization values */
00099   EFM_ASSERT((uint32_t)init->timeCtrl.startDelay < 4U);
00100   EFM_ASSERT((uint32_t)init->perCtrl.dacPresc < 32U);
00101 
00102   /* Reset LESENSE registers if requested. */
00103   if (reqReset)
00104   {
00105     LESENSE_Reset();
00106   }
00107 
00108   /* Set sensor start delay for each channel. */
00109   LESENSE_StartDelaySet((uint32_t)init->timeCtrl.startDelay);
00110 
00111   /* LESENSE core control configuration.
00112    * Set PRS source, SCANCONF register usage strategy, interrupt and
00113    * DMA trigger level condition, DMA wakeup condition, bias mode,
00114    * enable/disable to sample both ACMPs simultaneously, enable/disable to store
00115    * SCANRES in CNT_RES after each scan, enable/disable to always write to the
00116    * result buffer, even if it is full, enable/disable LESENSE running in debug
00117    * mode. */
00118   LESENSE->CTRL =
00119     ((uint32_t)init->coreCtrl.prsSel         << _LESENSE_CTRL_PRSSEL_SHIFT)
00120     | (uint32_t)init->coreCtrl.scanConfSel
00121     | (uint32_t)init->coreCtrl.bufTrigLevel
00122     | (uint32_t)init->coreCtrl.wakeupOnDMA
00123     | ((uint32_t)init->coreCtrl.invACMP0     << _LESENSE_CTRL_ACMP0INV_SHIFT)
00124     | ((uint32_t)init->coreCtrl.invACMP1     << _LESENSE_CTRL_ACMP1INV_SHIFT)
00125     | ((uint32_t)init->coreCtrl.dualSample   << _LESENSE_CTRL_DUALSAMPLE_SHIFT)
00126     | ((uint32_t)init->coreCtrl.storeScanRes << _LESENSE_CTRL_STRSCANRES_SHIFT)
00127     | ((uint32_t)init->coreCtrl.bufOverWr    << _LESENSE_CTRL_BUFOW_SHIFT)
00128     | ((uint32_t)init->coreCtrl.debugRun     << _LESENSE_CTRL_DEBUGRUN_SHIFT);
00129 
00130   /* Set scan mode in the CTRL register using the provided function, don't
00131    * start scanning immediately. */
00132   LESENSE_ScanModeSet((LESENSE_ScanMode_TypeDef)init->coreCtrl.scanStart, false);
00133 
00134   /* LESENSE peripheral control configuration.
00135    * Set DAC0 and DAC1 data source, conversion mode, output mode. Set DAC
00136    * prescaler and reference. Set ACMP0 and ACMP1 control mode. Set ACMP and DAC
00137    * duty cycle (warm up) mode. */
00138   LESENSE->PERCTRL =
00139     ((uint32_t)init->perCtrl.dacCh0Data       << _LESENSE_PERCTRL_DACCH0DATA_SHIFT)
00140     | ((uint32_t)init->perCtrl.dacCh0ConvMode << _LESENSE_PERCTRL_DACCH0CONV_SHIFT)
00141     | ((uint32_t)init->perCtrl.dacCh0OutMode  << _LESENSE_PERCTRL_DACCH0OUT_SHIFT)
00142     | ((uint32_t)init->perCtrl.dacCh1Data     << _LESENSE_PERCTRL_DACCH1DATA_SHIFT)
00143     | ((uint32_t)init->perCtrl.dacCh1ConvMode << _LESENSE_PERCTRL_DACCH1CONV_SHIFT)
00144     | ((uint32_t)init->perCtrl.dacCh1OutMode  << _LESENSE_PERCTRL_DACCH1OUT_SHIFT)
00145     | ((uint32_t)init->perCtrl.dacPresc       << _LESENSE_PERCTRL_DACPRESC_SHIFT)
00146     | (uint32_t)init->perCtrl.dacRef
00147     | ((uint32_t)init->perCtrl.acmp0Mode      << _LESENSE_PERCTRL_ACMP0MODE_SHIFT)
00148     | ((uint32_t)init->perCtrl.acmp1Mode      << _LESENSE_PERCTRL_ACMP1MODE_SHIFT)
00149     | (uint32_t)init->perCtrl.warmupMode;
00150 
00151   /* LESENSE decoder general control configuration.
00152    * Set decoder input source, select PRS input for decoder bits.
00153    * Enable/disable the decoder to check the present state.
00154    * Enable/disable decoder to channel interrupt mapping.
00155    * Enable/disable decoder hysteresis on PRS output.
00156    * Enable/disable decoder hysteresis on count events.
00157    * Enable/disable decoder hysteresis on interrupt requests.
00158    * Enable/disable count mode on LESPRS0 and LESPRS1. */
00159   LESENSE->DECCTRL =
00160     (uint32_t)init->decCtrl.decInput
00161     | ((uint32_t)init->decCtrl.prsChSel0 << _LESENSE_DECCTRL_PRSSEL0_SHIFT)
00162     | ((uint32_t)init->decCtrl.prsChSel1 << _LESENSE_DECCTRL_PRSSEL1_SHIFT)
00163     | ((uint32_t)init->decCtrl.prsChSel2 << _LESENSE_DECCTRL_PRSSEL2_SHIFT)
00164     | ((uint32_t)init->decCtrl.prsChSel3 << _LESENSE_DECCTRL_PRSSEL3_SHIFT)
00165     | ((uint32_t)init->decCtrl.chkState  << _LESENSE_DECCTRL_ERRCHK_SHIFT)
00166     | ((uint32_t)init->decCtrl.intMap    << _LESENSE_DECCTRL_INTMAP_SHIFT)
00167     | ((uint32_t)init->decCtrl.hystPRS0  << _LESENSE_DECCTRL_HYSTPRS0_SHIFT)
00168     | ((uint32_t)init->decCtrl.hystPRS1  << _LESENSE_DECCTRL_HYSTPRS1_SHIFT)
00169     | ((uint32_t)init->decCtrl.hystPRS2  << _LESENSE_DECCTRL_HYSTPRS2_SHIFT)
00170     | ((uint32_t)init->decCtrl.hystIRQ   << _LESENSE_DECCTRL_HYSTIRQ_SHIFT)
00171     | ((uint32_t)init->decCtrl.prsCount  << _LESENSE_DECCTRL_PRSCNT_SHIFT);
00172 
00173   /* Set initial LESENSE decoder state. */
00174   LESENSE_DecoderStateSet((uint32_t)init->decCtrl.initState);
00175 
00176   /* LESENSE bias control configuration. */
00177   LESENSE->BIASCTRL = (uint32_t)init->coreCtrl.biasMode;
00178 }

00181 /***************************************************************************/
00207 uint32_t LESENSE_ScanFreqSet(uint32_t refFreq, uint32_t const scanFreq)
00208 {
00209   uint32_t tmp;
00210   uint32_t pcPresc = 0UL;  /* Period counter prescaler. */
00211   uint32_t clkDiv  = 1UL;  /* Clock divisor value (2^pcPresc). */
00212   uint32_t pcTop   = 63UL; /* Period counter top value (max. 63). */
00213   uint32_t calcScanFreq;   /* Variable for testing the calculation algorithm. */
00214 
00215 
00216   /* If refFreq is set to 0, the currently configured reference clock is
00217    * assumed. */
00218   if (!refFreq)
00219   {
00220     refFreq = CMU_ClockFreqGet(cmuClock_LESENSE);
00221   }
00222 
00223   /* Max. value of pcPresc is 128, thus using reference frequency less than
00224    * 33554431Hz (33.554431MHz), the frequency calculation in the while loop
00225    * below will not overflow. */
00226   EFM_ASSERT(refFreq < ((uint32_t)UINT32_MAX / 128UL));
00227 
00228   /* Sanity check of scan frequency value. */
00229   EFM_ASSERT((scanFreq > 0U) && (scanFreq <= refFreq));
00230 
00231   /* Calculate the minimum necessary prescaler value in order to provide the
00232    * biggest possible resolution for setting scan frequency.
00233    * Maximum number of calculation cycles is 7 (value of lesenseClkDiv_128). */
00234   while ((refFreq / ((uint32_t)scanFreq * clkDiv) > (pcTop + 1UL))
00235          && (pcPresc < lesenseClkDiv_128))
00236   {
00237     ++pcPresc;
00238     clkDiv = (uint32_t)1UL << pcPresc;
00239   }
00240 
00241   /* Calculate pcTop value. */
00242   pcTop = ((uint32_t)refFreq / ((uint32_t)scanFreq * clkDiv)) - 1UL;
00243 
00244   /* Clear current PCPRESC and PCTOP settings. Be aware of the effect of
00245    * non-atomic Read-Modify-Write on LESENSE->TIMCRTL. */
00246   tmp = LESENSE->TIMCTRL & (~_LESENSE_TIMCTRL_PCPRESC_MASK
00247                             & ~_LESENSE_TIMCTRL_PCTOP_MASK);
00248 
00249   /* Set new values in tmp while reserving other settings. */
00250   tmp |= ((uint32_t)pcPresc << _LESENSE_TIMCTRL_PCPRESC_SHIFT)
00251          | ((uint32_t)pcTop << _LESENSE_TIMCTRL_PCTOP_SHIFT);
00252 
00253   /* Set values in LESENSE_TIMCTRL register. */
00254   LESENSE->TIMCTRL = tmp;
00255 
00256   /* For testing the calculation algorithm. */
00257   calcScanFreq = ((uint32_t)refFreq / ((uint32_t)(1UL + pcTop) * clkDiv));
00258 
00259   return calcScanFreq;
00260 }

00263 /***************************************************************************/
00289 void LESENSE_ScanModeSet(LESENSE_ScanMode_TypeDef const scanMode,
00290                          bool const start)
00291 {
00292   uint32_t tmp; /* temporary storage of the CTRL register value */
00293 
00294 
00295   /* Save the CTRL register value to tmp.
00296    * Please be aware the effects of the non-atomic Read-Modify-Write cycle! */
00297   tmp = LESENSE->CTRL & ~(_LESENSE_CTRL_SCANMODE_MASK);
00298   /* Setting the requested scanMode to the CTRL register. Casting signed int
00299    * (enum) to unsigned long (uint32_t). */
00300   tmp |= (uint32_t)scanMode;
00301 
00302   /* Write the new value to the CTRL register. */
00303   LESENSE->CTRL = tmp;
00304 
00305   /* Start sensor scanning if requested. */
00306   if (start)
00307   {
00308     LESENSE_ScanStart();
00309   }
00310 }
00311

00313 /***************************************************************************/
00331 void LESENSE_StartDelaySet(uint8_t const startDelay)
00332 {
00333   uint32_t tmp; /* temporary storage of the TIMCTRL register value */
00334 
00335 
00336   /* Sanity check of startDelay. */
00337   EFM_ASSERT(startDelay < 4U);
00338 
00339   /* Save the TIMCTRL register value to tmp.
00340    * Please be aware the effects of the non-atomic Read-Modify-Write cycle! */
00341   tmp = LESENSE->TIMCTRL & ~(_LESENSE_TIMCTRL_STARTDLY_MASK);
00342   /* Setting the requested startDelay to the TIMCTRL register. */
00343   tmp |= (uint32_t)startDelay << _LESENSE_TIMCTRL_STARTDLY_SHIFT;
00344 
00345   /* Write the new value to the TIMCTRL register. */
00346   LESENSE->TIMCTRL = tmp;
00347 }

00350 /***************************************************************************/
00374 void LESENSE_ClkDivSet(LESENSE_ChClk_TypeDef const clk,
00375                        LESENSE_ClkPresc_TypeDef const clkDiv)
00376 {
00377   uint32_t tmp;
00378 
00379 
00380   /* Select clock to prescale */
00381   switch (clk)
00382   {
00383     case lesenseClkHF:
00384       /* Sanity check of clock divisor for HF clock. */
00385       EFM_ASSERT((uint32_t)clkDiv <= lesenseClkDiv_8);
00386 
00387       /* Clear current AUXPRESC settings. */
00388       tmp = LESENSE->TIMCTRL & ~(_LESENSE_TIMCTRL_AUXPRESC_MASK);
00389 
00390       /* Set new values in tmp while reserving other settings. */
00391       tmp |= ((uint32_t)clkDiv << _LESENSE_TIMCTRL_AUXPRESC_SHIFT);
00392 
00393       /* Set values in LESENSE_TIMCTRL register. */
00394       LESENSE->TIMCTRL = tmp;
00395       break;
00396 
00397     case lesenseClkLF:
00398       /* Clear current LFPRESC settings. */
00399       tmp = LESENSE->TIMCTRL & ~(_LESENSE_TIMCTRL_LFPRESC_MASK);
00400 
00401       /* Set new values in tmp while reserving other settings. */
00402       tmp |= ((uint32_t)clkDiv << _LESENSE_TIMCTRL_LFPRESC_SHIFT);
00403 
00404       /* Set values in LESENSE_TIMCTRL register. */
00405       LESENSE->TIMCTRL = tmp;
00406       break;
00407 
00408     default:
00409       EFM_ASSERT(0);
00410       break;
00411   }
00412 }

00415 /***************************************************************************/
00436 void LESENSE_ChannelAllConfig(LESENSE_ChAll_TypeDef const *confChAll)
00437 {
00438   uint32_t i;
00439 
00440   /* Iterate through all the 16 channels */
00441   for (i = 0U; i < 16U; ++i)
00442   {
00443     /* Configure scan channels. */
00444     LESENSE_ChannelConfig(&confChAll->Ch[i], i);
00445   }
00446 }

00449 /***************************************************************************/
00471 void LESENSE_ChannelConfig(LESENSE_ChDesc_TypeDef const *confCh,
00472                            uint32_t const chIdx)
00473 {
00474   uint32_t tmp; /* Service variable. */
00475 
00476 
00477   /* Sanity check of configuration parameters */
00478   EFM_ASSERT(chIdx < 16U);
00479   EFM_ASSERT(confCh->exTime < 64U);
00480   EFM_ASSERT(confCh->sampleDelay < 128U);
00481   EFM_ASSERT(confCh->measDelay < 128U);
00482   /* Not a complete assert, as the max. value of acmpThres depends on other
00483    * configuration parameters, check the parameter description of acmpThres for
00484    * for more details! */
00485   EFM_ASSERT(confCh->acmpThres < 4096U);
00486   EFM_ASSERT(!(confCh->chPinExMode == lesenseChPinExDACOut
00487                && (chIdx != 2U)
00488                && (chIdx != 3U)
00489                && (chIdx != 4U)
00490                && (chIdx != 5U)));
00491   EFM_ASSERT(!(confCh->chPinIdleMode == lesenseChPinIdleDACCh1
00492                && ((chIdx != 12U)
00493                    && (chIdx != 13U)
00494                    && (chIdx != 14U)
00495                    && (chIdx != 15U))));
00496   EFM_ASSERT(!(confCh->chPinIdleMode == lesenseChPinIdleDACCh0
00497                && ((chIdx != 0U)
00498                    && (chIdx != 1U)
00499                    && (chIdx != 2U)
00500                    && (chIdx != 3U))));
00501 
00502   /* Configure chIdx setup in LESENSE idle phase.
00503    * Read-modify-write in order to support reconfiguration during LESENSE
00504    * operation. */
00505   tmp               = (LESENSE->IDLECONF & ~((uint32_t)0x3UL << (chIdx * 2UL)));
00506   tmp              |= ((uint32_t)confCh->chPinIdleMode << (chIdx * 2UL));
00507   LESENSE->IDLECONF = tmp;
00508 
00509   /* Channel specific timing configuration on scan channel chIdx.
00510    * Set excitation time, sampling delay, measurement delay. */
00511   LESENSE_ChannelTimingSet(chIdx,
00512                            (uint32_t)confCh->exTime,
00513                            (uint32_t)confCh->sampleDelay,
00514                            (uint32_t)confCh->measDelay);
00515 
00516   /* Channel specific configuration of clocks, sample mode, excitation pin mode
00517    * alternate excitation usage and interrupt mode on scan channel chIdx in
00518    * LESENSE_CHchIdx_INTERACT. */
00519   LESENSE->CH[chIdx].INTERACT =
00520         ((uint32_t)confCh->exClk       << _LESENSE_CH_INTERACT_EXCLK_SHIFT)
00521         | ((uint32_t)confCh->sampleClk << _LESENSE_CH_INTERACT_SAMPLECLK_SHIFT)
00522         | (uint32_t)confCh->sampleMode
00523         | (uint32_t)confCh->intMode
00524         | (uint32_t)confCh->chPinExMode
00525         | ((uint32_t)confCh->useAltEx  << _LESENSE_CH_INTERACT_ALTEX_SHIFT);
00526 
00527   /* Configure channel specific counter comparison mode, optional result
00528    * forwarding to decoder, optional counter value storing and optional result
00529    * inverting on scan channel chIdx in LESENSE_CHchIdx_EVAL. */
00530   LESENSE->CH[chIdx].EVAL =
00531         (uint32_t)confCh->compMode
00532         | ((uint32_t)confCh->shiftRes    << _LESENSE_CH_EVAL_DECODE_SHIFT)
00533         | ((uint32_t)confCh->storeCntRes << _LESENSE_CH_EVAL_STRSAMPLE_SHIFT)
00534         | ((uint32_t)confCh->invRes      << _LESENSE_CH_EVAL_SCANRESINV_SHIFT);
00535 
00536   /* Configure analog comparator (ACMP) threshold and decision threshold for
00537    * counter separately with the function provided for that. */
00538   LESENSE_ChannelThresSet(chIdx,
00539                          (uint32_t)confCh->acmpThres,
00540                          (uint32_t)confCh->cntThres);
00541 
00542   /* Enable/disable interrupts on channel.
00543    * Note: BUS_RegBitWrite() function is used for setting/clearing single
00544    * bit peripheral register bitfields. Read the function description in
00545    * em_bus.h for more details. */
00546   BUS_RegBitWrite(&(LESENSE->IEN), chIdx, confCh->enaInt);
00547 
00548   /* Enable/disable CHchIdx pin. */
00549   BUS_RegBitWrite(&(LESENSE->ROUTE), chIdx, confCh->enaPin);
00550 
00551   /* Enable/disable scan channel chIdx. */
00552   BUS_RegBitWrite(&(LESENSE->CHEN), chIdx, confCh->enaScanCh);
00553 }

00555 
00556 /***************************************************************************/
00573 void LESENSE_AltExConfig(LESENSE_ConfAltEx_TypeDef const *confAltEx)
00574 {
00575   uint32_t i;
00576   uint32_t tmp;
00577 
00578 
00579   /* Configure alternate excitation mapping.
00580    * Atomic read-modify-write using BUS_RegBitWrite function in order to
00581    * support reconfiguration during LESENSE operation. */
00582   BUS_RegBitWrite(&(LESENSE->CTRL),
00583                   _LESENSE_CTRL_ALTEXMAP_SHIFT,
00584                   confAltEx->altExMap);
00585 
00586   switch (confAltEx->altExMap)
00587   {
00588     case lesenseAltExMapALTEX:
00589       /* Iterate through the 8 possible alternate excitation pin descriptors. */
00590       for (i = 0U; i < 8U; ++i)
00591       {
00592         /* Enable/disable alternate excitation pin i.
00593          * Atomic read-modify-write using BUS_RegBitWrite function in order to
00594          * support reconfiguration during LESENSE operation. */
00595         BUS_RegBitWrite(&(LESENSE->ROUTE),
00596                         (16UL + i),
00597                         confAltEx->AltEx[i].enablePin);
00598 
00599         /* Setup the idle phase state of alternate excitation pin i.
00600          * Read-modify-write in order to support reconfiguration during LESENSE
00601          * operation. */
00602         tmp                = (LESENSE->ALTEXCONF & ~((uint32_t)0x3UL << (i * 2UL)));
00603         tmp               |= ((uint32_t)confAltEx->AltEx[i].idleConf << (i * 2UL));
00604         LESENSE->ALTEXCONF = tmp;
00605 
00606         /* Enable/disable always excite on channel i */
00607         BUS_RegBitWrite(&(LESENSE->ALTEXCONF),
00608                         (16UL + i),
00609                         confAltEx->AltEx[i].alwaysEx);
00610       }
00611       break;
00612 
00613     case lesenseAltExMapACMP:
00614       /* Iterate through all the 16 alternate excitation channels */
00615       for (i = 0U; i < 16U; ++i)
00616       {
00617         /* Enable/disable alternate ACMP excitation channel pin i. */
00618         /* Atomic read-modify-write using BUS_RegBitWrite function in order to
00619          * support reconfiguration during LESENSE operation. */
00620         BUS_RegBitWrite(&(LESENSE->ROUTE),
00621                         i,
00622                         confAltEx->AltEx[i].enablePin);
00623       }
00624       break;
00625     default:
00626       /* Illegal value. */
00627       EFM_ASSERT(0);
00628       break;
00629   }
00630 }

00633 /***************************************************************************/
00657 void LESENSE_ChannelEnable(uint8_t const chIdx,
00658                            bool const enaScanCh,
00659                            bool const enaPin)
00660 {
00661   /* Enable/disable the assigned pin of scan channel chIdx.
00662    * Note: BUS_RegBitWrite() function is used for setting/clearing single
00663    * bit peripheral register bitfields. Read the function description in
00664    * em_bus.h for more details. */
00665   BUS_RegBitWrite(&(LESENSE->ROUTE), chIdx, enaPin);
00666 
00667   /* Enable/disable scan channel chIdx. */
00668   BUS_RegBitWrite(&(LESENSE->CHEN), chIdx, enaScanCh);
00669 }
00670 
00671 
00672 /***************************************************************************/
00694 void LESENSE_ChannelEnableMask(uint16_t chMask, uint16_t pinMask)
00695 {
00696   /* Enable/disable all channels at once according to the mask. */
00697   LESENSE->CHEN = chMask;
00698   /* Enable/disable all channel pins at once according to the mask. */
00699   LESENSE->ROUTE = pinMask;
00700 }

00703 /***************************************************************************/
00731 void LESENSE_ChannelTimingSet(uint8_t const chIdx,
00732                               uint8_t const exTime,
00733                               uint8_t const sampleDelay,
00734                               uint8_t const measDelay)
00735 {
00736   /* Sanity check of parameters. */
00737   EFM_ASSERT(exTime < 64U);
00738   EFM_ASSERT(sampleDelay < 128U);
00739   EFM_ASSERT(measDelay < 128U);
00740 
00741   /* Channel specific timing configuration on scan channel chIdx.
00742    * Setting excitation time, sampling delay, measurement delay. */
00743   LESENSE->CH[chIdx].TIMING =
00744               ((uint32_t)exTime        << _LESENSE_CH_TIMING_EXTIME_SHIFT)
00745               | ((uint32_t)sampleDelay << _LESENSE_CH_TIMING_SAMPLEDLY_SHIFT)
00746               | ((uint32_t)measDelay   << _LESENSE_CH_TIMING_MEASUREDLY_SHIFT);
00747 }

00750 /***************************************************************************/
00783 void LESENSE_ChannelThresSet(uint8_t const chIdx,
00784                              uint16_t const acmpThres,
00785                              uint16_t const cntThres)
00786 {
00787   uint32_t tmp; /* temporary storage */
00788 
00789 
00790   /* Sanity check for acmpThres only, cntThres is 16bit value. */
00791   EFM_ASSERT(acmpThres < 4096U);
00792   /* Sanity check for LESENSE channel id. */
00793   EFM_ASSERT(chIdx < 16);
00794 
00795   /* Save the INTERACT register value of channel chIdx to tmp.
00796    * Please be aware the effects of the non-atomic Read-Modify-Write cycle! */
00797   tmp = LESENSE->CH[chIdx].INTERACT & ~(_LESENSE_CH_INTERACT_ACMPTHRES_MASK);
00798   /* Set the ACMP threshold value to the INTERACT register of channel chIdx. */
00799   tmp |= (uint32_t)acmpThres << _LESENSE_CH_INTERACT_ACMPTHRES_SHIFT;
00800   /* Write the new value to the INTERACT register. */
00801   LESENSE->CH[chIdx].INTERACT = tmp;
00802 
00803   /* Save the EVAL register value of channel chIdx to tmp.
00804    * Please be aware the effects of the non-atomic Read-Modify-Write cycle! */
00805   tmp = LESENSE->CH[chIdx].EVAL & ~(_LESENSE_CH_EVAL_COMPTHRES_MASK);
00806   /* Set the counter threshold value to the INTERACT register of channel chIdx. */
00807   tmp |= (uint32_t)cntThres << _LESENSE_CH_EVAL_COMPTHRES_SHIFT;
00808   /* Write the new value to the EVAL register. */
00809   LESENSE->CH[chIdx].EVAL = tmp;
00810 }

00813 /***************************************************************************/
00829 void LESENSE_DecoderStateAllConfig(LESENSE_DecStAll_TypeDef const *confDecStAll)
00830 {
00831   uint32_t i;
00832 
00833   /* Iterate through all the 16 decoder states. */
00834   for (i = 0U; i < 16U; ++i)
00835   {
00836     /* Configure decoder state i. */
00837     LESENSE_DecoderStateConfig(&confDecStAll->St[i], i);
00838   }
00839 }

00841 
00842 /***************************************************************************/
00857 void LESENSE_DecoderStateConfig(LESENSE_DecStDesc_TypeDef const *confDecSt,
00858                                 uint32_t const decSt)
00859 {
00860   /* Sanity check of configuration parameters */
00861   EFM_ASSERT(decSt < 16U);
00862   EFM_ASSERT((uint32_t)confDecSt->confA.compMask < 16U);
00863   EFM_ASSERT((uint32_t)confDecSt->confA.compVal < 16U);
00864   EFM_ASSERT((uint32_t)confDecSt->confA.nextState < 16U);
00865   EFM_ASSERT((uint32_t)confDecSt->confB.compMask < 16U);
00866   EFM_ASSERT((uint32_t)confDecSt->confB.compVal < 16U);
00867   EFM_ASSERT((uint32_t)confDecSt->confB.nextState < 16U);
00868 
00869   /* Configure state descriptor A (LESENSE_STi_TCONFA) for decoder state i.
00870    * Setting sensor compare value, sensor mask, next state index,
00871    * transition action, interrupt flag option and state descriptor chaining
00872    * configurations. */
00873   LESENSE->ST[decSt].TCONFA =
00874     (uint32_t)confDecSt->confA.prsAct
00875     | ((uint32_t)confDecSt->confA.compMask  << _LESENSE_ST_TCONFA_MASK_SHIFT)
00876     | ((uint32_t)confDecSt->confA.compVal   << _LESENSE_ST_TCONFA_COMP_SHIFT)
00877     | ((uint32_t)confDecSt->confA.nextState << _LESENSE_ST_TCONFA_NEXTSTATE_SHIFT)
00878     | ((uint32_t)confDecSt->confA.setInt    << _LESENSE_ST_TCONFA_SETIF_SHIFT)
00879     | ((uint32_t)confDecSt->chainDesc       << _LESENSE_ST_TCONFA_CHAIN_SHIFT);
00880 
00881   /* Configure state descriptor Bi (LESENSE_STi_TCONFB).
00882    * Setting sensor compare value, sensor mask, next state index, transition
00883    * action and interrupt flag option configurations. */
00884   LESENSE->ST[decSt].TCONFB =
00885   (uint32_t)confDecSt->confB.prsAct
00886     | ((uint32_t)confDecSt->confB.compMask  << _LESENSE_ST_TCONFB_MASK_SHIFT)
00887     | ((uint32_t)confDecSt->confB.compVal   << _LESENSE_ST_TCONFB_COMP_SHIFT)
00888     | ((uint32_t)confDecSt->confB.nextState << _LESENSE_ST_TCONFB_NEXTSTATE_SHIFT)
00889     | ((uint32_t)confDecSt->confB.setInt    << _LESENSE_ST_TCONFB_SETIF_SHIFT);
00890 }
00891 
00892 
00893 /***************************************************************************/
00908 void LESENSE_DecoderStateSet(uint32_t decSt)
00909 {
00910   EFM_ASSERT(decSt < 16U);
00911 
00912   LESENSE->DECSTATE = decSt & _LESENSE_DECSTATE_DECSTATE_MASK;
00913 }
00914 
00915 
00916 /***************************************************************************/
00924 uint32_t LESENSE_DecoderStateGet(void)
00925 {
00926   return LESENSE->DECSTATE & _LESENSE_DECSTATE_DECSTATE_MASK;
00927 }
00928

00930 /***************************************************************************/
00943 void LESENSE_ScanStart(void)
00944 {
00945   /* Wait for any pending previous write operation to the CMD register to
00946      complete before accessing the CMD register. */
00947   while (LESENSE_SYNCBUSY_CMD & LESENSE->SYNCBUSY)
00948     ;
00949 
00950   /* Start scanning of sensors */
00951   LESENSE->CMD = LESENSE_CMD_START;
00952 
00953   /* Wait for the write operation to the CMD register to complete before
00954      returning. */
00955   while (LESENSE_SYNCBUSY_CMD & LESENSE->SYNCBUSY)
00956     ;
00957 }
00958 
00959 
00960 /***************************************************************************/
00976 void LESENSE_ScanStop(void)
00977 {
00978   /* Wait for any pending previous write operation to the CMD register to
00979      complete before accessing the CMD register. */
00980   while (LESENSE_SYNCBUSY_CMD & LESENSE->SYNCBUSY)
00981     ;
00982 
00983   /* Stop scanning of sensors */
00984   LESENSE->CMD = LESENSE_CMD_STOP;
00985 
00986   /* Wait for the write operation to the CMD register to complete before
00987      returning. */
00988   while (LESENSE_SYNCBUSY_CMD & LESENSE->SYNCBUSY)
00989     ;
00990 }
00991 
00992 
00993 /***************************************************************************/
01006 void LESENSE_DecoderStart(void)
01007 {
01008   /* Wait for any pending previous write operation to the CMD register to
01009      complete before accessing the CMD register. */
01010   while (LESENSE_SYNCBUSY_CMD & LESENSE->SYNCBUSY)
01011     ;
01012 
01013   /* Start decoder */
01014   LESENSE->CMD = LESENSE_CMD_DECODE;
01015 
01016   /* Wait for the write operation to the CMD register to complete before
01017      returning. */
01018   while (LESENSE_SYNCBUSY_CMD & LESENSE->SYNCBUSY)
01019     ;
01020 }
01021

01023 /***************************************************************************/
01036 void LESENSE_ResultBufferClear(void)
01037 {
01038   /* Wait for any pending previous write operation to the CMD register to
01039      complete before accessing the CMD register. */
01040   while (LESENSE_SYNCBUSY_CMD & LESENSE->SYNCBUSY)
01041     ;
01042 
01043   LESENSE->CMD = LESENSE_CMD_CLEARBUF;
01044 
01045   /* Wait for the write operation to the CMD register to complete before
01046      returning. */
01047   while (LESENSE_SYNCBUSY_CMD & LESENSE->SYNCBUSY)
01048     ;
01049 }
01050 
01051 
01052 /***************************************************************************/
01065 void LESENSE_Reset(void)
01066 {
01067   uint32_t i;
01068 
01069   /* Disable all LESENSE interrupts first */
01070   LESENSE->IEN = _LESENSE_IEN_RESETVALUE;
01071 
01072   /* Clear all pending LESENSE interrupts */
01073   LESENSE->IFC = _LESENSE_IFC_MASK;
01074 
01075   /* Stop the decoder */
01076   LESENSE->DECCTRL |= LESENSE_DECCTRL_DISABLE;
01077 
01078   /* Wait for any pending previous write operation to the CMD register to
01079      complete before accessing the CMD register. */
01080   while (LESENSE_SYNCBUSY_CMD & LESENSE->SYNCBUSY)
01081     ;
01082 
01083   /* Stop sensor scan and clear result buffer */
01084   LESENSE->CMD = (LESENSE_CMD_STOP | LESENSE_CMD_CLEARBUF);
01085 
01086   /* Reset LESENSE configuration registers */
01087   LESENSE->CTRL      = _LESENSE_CTRL_RESETVALUE;
01088   LESENSE->PERCTRL   = _LESENSE_PERCTRL_RESETVALUE;
01089   LESENSE->DECCTRL   = _LESENSE_DECCTRL_RESETVALUE;
01090   LESENSE->BIASCTRL  = _LESENSE_BIASCTRL_RESETVALUE;
01091   LESENSE->CHEN      = _LESENSE_CHEN_RESETVALUE;
01092   LESENSE->IDLECONF  = _LESENSE_IDLECONF_RESETVALUE;
01093   LESENSE->ALTEXCONF = _LESENSE_ALTEXCONF_RESETVALUE;
01094 
01095   /* Disable LESENSE to control GPIO pins */
01096   LESENSE->ROUTE = _LESENSE_ROUTE_RESETVALUE;
01097 
01098   /* Reset all channel configuration registers */
01099   for (i = 0U; i < 16U; ++i)
01100   {
01101     LESENSE->CH[i].TIMING   = _LESENSE_CH_TIMING_RESETVALUE;
01102     LESENSE->CH[i].INTERACT = _LESENSE_CH_INTERACT_RESETVALUE;
01103     LESENSE->CH[i].EVAL     = _LESENSE_CH_EVAL_RESETVALUE;
01104   }
01105 
01106   /* Reset all decoder state configuration registers */
01107   for (i = 0U; i < 16U; ++i)
01108   {
01109     LESENSE->ST[i].TCONFA = _LESENSE_ST_TCONFA_RESETVALUE;
01110     LESENSE->ST[i].TCONFB = _LESENSE_ST_TCONFB_RESETVALUE;
01111   }
01112 
01113   /* Wait for the write operation to the CMD register to complete before
01114      returning. */
01115   while (LESENSE_SYNCBUSY_CMD & LESENSE->SYNCBUSY)
01116     ;
01117 }
01118

01123 #endif /* defined(LESENSE_COUNT) && (LESENSE_COUNT > 0) */
